sentences.en: But here all the foundations of typical monogamy are cleared away.
sentences.cn: 不过,在这里,古典的一夫一妻制的全部基础也就除去了.

sentences.en: How monogamy fares during this epoch, therefore, only occupies him very briefly.
sentences.cn: 所以, 他只是非常简单地论述了一下一夫一妻制在这一时期的命运.

sentences.en: Leaders are mostly shaman, line monogamy.
sentences.cn: 首领多为萨满, 行一夫一妻制.

sentences.en: McLennan knew only three forms of marriage: polygyny, polyandry and monogamy.
sentences.cn: 麦克伦南只知道三种婚姻形式: 一夫多妻制, 一妻多夫制和个体婚制.

sentences.en: Monogamy is rare in most animal groups, but is common among birds.
sentences.cn: 单配偶现象在大多数兽类群体里很少见，但在鸟类中却很常见。

sentences.en: People still opt for monogamy and marriage.
sentences.cn: 人们仍然选择一夫一妻制。

sentences.en: Strongly against monogamy, Plato advocated this kind of marriages which were optional combination and postnatal care.
sentences.cn: 柏拉图反对一夫一妻制, 提倡婚姻最优结合和优生优育.

sentences.en: Such a form of family shows the transition of the pairing family to monogamy.
sentences.cn: 这种家庭形式表示着从对偶婚向一夫一妻制的过渡.

sentences.en: The form of marriage , as already said , was a pairing marriage which was gradually approaching monogamy.
sentences.cn: 如前所述, 婚姻的形式是逐渐接近一夫一妻制的对偶婚制.

sentences.en: Under monogamy, they are stuck with marrying a poorer man.
sentences.cn: 在一夫一妻制下, 她们就陷入要和更加贫穷男性结婚的下场.

words.tran_cn: 一夫一妻的；[动] 单配的

trans.tran_en: the custom of being married to only one husband or wife
